content.query:
USE nyc_taxi_discovery;

-- read file vendor_unquoted.csv this file contains one name and this name contains comma
SELECT * 
    FROM OPENROWSET (
        BULK 'vendor_unquoted.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'csv',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION ='2.0',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    )AS vendor;

    -- Read file vendor_escaped.csv  this value contain \ in name

    SELECT * 
    FROM OPENROWSET (
        BULK 'vendor_escaped.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'csv',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION ='2.0',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    )AS vendor;

    -- how to deal with this file use escapechar
    SELECT * 
    FROM OPENROWSET (
        BULK 'vendor_escaped.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'csv',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION ='2.0',
        ESCAPECHAR = '\',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    )AS vendor;

    -- read vendor file name value in double qoute "" then use FIELDQUOTE = '"'
    SELECT * 
    FROM OPENROWSET (
        BULK 'vendor.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'csv',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION ='2.0',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        FIELDQUOTE = '"',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    )AS vendor;
